intro: Oxytropis chesneyoides, commonly known as Chesney's milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has a deep taproot system that allows it to access water from deeper soil layers. Oxytropis chesneyoides is also known for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, contributing to soil fertility.
